column4: err... internal I think, it's the one that is stuck in my pc and is not removeable
it should be that easy, is the drive NTFS?
nope, ext3
it says I have not the acccfes to write to it when i try to write to it
external or internal?
kde (kubuntu) or gnome (ubuntu)?  kubuntu has a "change read write" mode option, I'm just checking which you have
It's gnome
ubuntu
try "sudo mount -a"
first unmount the partition/drive "sudo umount /mountpoint"
then try "sudo mount -a"  just checking, you aren't talking about your root partition, are you?
: Not anymore, I fragmented that drive (it  was my root before), but then I reinstalled ubuntu and it's just a normal "media"-drive now
: what should I see when i "sudo mount -a"

ext3 doesn't really get fragmented.  it could be read only if there are problems with the drive or partition, that's happened to me before.  mount -a shouldn't return anything, it just mounts everything
:one line from the return of mount all command "FUSE mount point creation failed"
it says a bit more things too
still not working after "sudo mount -a" ,i still dont have write access
not sure, it's a bit past me with that error, sounds like something your PC is trying to mount can't be mounted
it could be partition/drive problems that prevents write access, but I'm not sure
: ok I can try ask someone else later
sorry I couldn't help more
you tried :), it's very nice of you anyway :)
